pr_title: KOGITO-1748 - VsCode editor - Package property is empty when the process is created

timeline.bodyText:
Hi @Josephblt,
we already have an ability to use file name as process ID. It because now we are getting file name with filepath from VS Code. My idea is to parse package from the path if possible. For example, if it is a maven project than file path will be like /some/path/ProjectName/src/main/java/folder/folder2/FileName.bpmn.
So, if file path contains src/main/java all between it and file name can be a package, just need to replace / or \ to dots. And if src/main/java pattern is not met, use default value. WDYT?
The code about file name is located here: https://github.com/hasys/kie-wb-common/blob/d94848a21f0f2966acc960dc9ddd9f7aa9b398bf/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-extensions/kie-wb-common-stunner-kogito/kie-wb-common-stunner-kogito-client/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/kogito/client/service/AbstractKogitoClientDiagramService.java
timeline.author: hasys

replies.bodyText:
Hey @hasys
Thanks for pointing this out. As already commented with @Josephblt I would keep this improvement in a new ticket, and let's discuss it on next meeting. It's because we were already considering this with @pefernan and @ederign , I mean about supporting maven directory structures on the projects, but it's still not present neither on the fundation side. So as  it's not a decision we're taking across the tooling, I'm not yet feeling confident with doing it.
replies.author: romartin

replies.bodyText:
Hello @LuboTerifaj, @romartin, @pefernan. Here is the JIRA to track your suggestion @LuboTerifaj.
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2014
Let's discuss this. Thanks.
replies.author: Josephblt

timeline.message:
KOGITO-1748 - VsCode editor - Package property is empty when the process is created

Package property is set to "default" on new .bpmn files. Existing files with empty values
for this property will also be set to "default".

timeline.bodyText: can it be private? or at least, package protected (no access modifier)?
timeline.author: romartin

timeline.bodyText: can it be private? or at least, package protected (no access modifier)?
timeline.author: romartin

timeline.bodyText: any reason for changing the type to a NullPointerException?
timeline.author: romartin

replies.bodyText: Well, this is flagged as code smell by SonarCloud. It complains about throwing generic exceptions. The exception that would be thrown in case we proceed with a null diagramNode is that one. So I decided to go with that.
replies.author: Josephblt
